person.persName: Ashbel Parsons Willard (Floyd County, Indiana, governor, Lt gov, attorney, IN state rep)

body.p: Floyd County, Indiana, governor, attorney, and politician. Oneida County, New York, native. Son of Erastus Willard and Sarah Parsons Willard. Married to Caroline C. Cook in Middlesex County, Connecticut, on May 27, 1847. Father of James H. Willard, Ashbel P. Willard, Jr., and Carrie C. Willard. Graduated from Hamilton College in Clinton, New York, in 1842. Attorney in Floyd County in 1850. Member of the Indiana House of Representatives from 1850 to 1852. Lieutenant governor of Indiana from 1853 to 1857. Governor of Indiana from January 12, 1857, to October 4, 1860. Employed Sarah Backus and Thomas Pomers as servants in Indianapolis in 1860.
